questions.text: The action of 'Goldeneye' takes place mainly in which country?
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	The movie's context is centred on the new Russia after the collapse of the USSR.

questions.text: In 'Goldeneye', for the first time, M is ....?
questions.explanation:
a female.

	Played by Dame Judi Dench, supposedly modelled on the real female M, Stella Rimington

questions.text: How does Bond descend the dam in the opening sequence?
questions.explanation:
Bungy jump.

	He then breaks into a weapons base, still hanging on the end of the rope

questions.text: Where does Natalya hide during the attack on her workplace?
questions.explanation:
Kitchen cupboard.

	She avoids the attack as she is out making a cup of tea

questions.text: Which Scottish actor plays the computer programmer Boris?
questions.explanation:
Alan Cumming.

	Alan Cumming starred as the compere in 'Cabaret' in London and on Broadway.

questions.text: What vehicle does James use to chase Natalya and Orumov across St. Petersburg?
questions.explanation:
Tank.

	It crashes through buildings and even collects a statue en route.

questions.text: What does Trevelyan use as his mobile headquarters?
questions.explanation:
Train.

	It is an armoured train that was used to transport military equipment during the Cold War.

questions.text: Where does Trevelyan have his final HQ?
questions.explanation:
Cuba.

	It is hidden under a lake to avoid radar detection.

questions.text: Which city is Trevelyan's target for 'Goldeneye'?
questions.explanation:
London.

	Trevelyan hates the British who sent his pro-Nazi Cossack parents back to Russia where they were executed.

questions.text: One of the 'Goldeneye' cast is called Bond in reality - who do they play?
